thread.title: New England Patriots players boycott White House visit after Super Bowl win in protest at Donald Trump

author: mirror.co.uk
title: New England Patriots players boycott White House visit after Super Bowl win in protest at Donald Trump

organizations.name: donald trump robert k. kraft martellus bennett tom brady atlanta falcons

text:
New England Patriots players boycott White House visit after Super Bowl win in protest at Donald Trump Martellus Bennett and Devin McCourty snubbed the invite despite Patriots owner Robert Kraft and quarterback Tom Brady being pals of the President   Share   Comments By Natalie Evans 04:21, 7 FEB 2017 Updated 04:23, 7 FEB 2017 Sport Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch Next Nigel Farage's wife refuses to say whether she is Watch this video again Watch Next Lady Gaga 'gets funky' in the dressing room ahead 0:18 Did The Simpsons predict Lady Gaga's super bowl h 0:53 Donald Trump attacks the press over 'lack of ISIS 0:52 Marine Le Pen cites Brexit and Trump as she kicks 1:11 Gisele Bundchen goes NUTS as Patriots win Super B 0:17 Watch: Incredible moment New England Patriots WIN 0:26 Tom Brady lifts the Lombardi trophy after incredi 0:29 Goosebumps? Stranger Things 2 trailer drops durin 0:29 Donald Trump meets marching band ahead of Super B 1:18 Bieber does a LOT of dancing in Super Bowl T-Mobi 1:00 Sean Spicer's Aussie gaffe! 0:35 Video will play in  Martellus Bennet says he WON'T attend White House after Super Bowl win Share this video Watch Next   Share   Comments Get daily   New England Patriots players have revealed they will boycott the team's visit to the White House following their epic Super Bowl win . 
The champions have been invited to Washington DC by Donald Trump after they came back from a 25-point deficit to beat the Atlanta Falcons . 
Patriots owner Robert Kraft, coach Bill Belichick and quarterback Tom Brady are all known to be pals of the President . 
But two of the stars of Sunday's game have said they will snub the invite in protest against Trump. 
Read More Super Bowl LI: Tom Brady and New England beat Atlanta in overtime thriller - 5 things we learned Martellus Bennett has made his political views well known (Photo: Rex Features) The tight end does not agree with Trump's presidency (Photo: AFP) Martellus Bennett told reporters in a post-game interview: "I’m not going to go." 
Asked why, the tight end replied: "It is what it is. People know how I feel about it. Just follow me on Twitter."
Last month, days after Trump signed an executive order implementing his controversial 'Muslim ban', Bennett tweeted: "America was built on inclusiveness not exclusiveness."
Bennett suggested at an earlier media day that he would like not attend the traditional celebration if the Patriots won "because I don’t support the guy in the house."
His sentiments were echoed by teammate Devin McCourty, who also confirmed he would not be joining in the White House visit.
Read More Lady Gaga DID take a dig at Donald Trump but it was so subtle most viewers missed it Patriots free safety Devin McCourty will also snub the invite (Photo: USA Today Sports) The free safety told Time Magazine: "Basic reason for me is I don't feel accepted in the White House.
"With the president having so many strong opinions and prejudices I believe certain people might feel accepted there while others won't."
McCourty in action during Sunday's game (Photo: USA Today Sports) McCourty added that attending the White House ceremony was a personal choice.
"I can't imagine a way I go there," he said.
Read More Super Bowl 2017 New England 34-28 Atlanta 5 things we learned Watch Super Bowl 2017 commercials Watch Lady Gaga's half-time show Funniest memes and reaction Watch Luke Bryan sing national anthem Lady Gaga DID take a dig at Trump Super Bowl latest news Trump is believed to have missed the Patriots incredible comeback after leaving his own Super Bowl party early when his team were being smashed 28-3 in the third quarter. 
Tom Brady's men managed to tie the game 28-28 and grab a last-gasp win with James White’s 2-yard touchdown in overtime.
Read More Tom Brady suspects his Super Bowl winning jersey was stolen from New England Patriots dressing room Trump attended a private Super Bowl party - but left early and missed the Patriots' comeback (Photo: Getty) Trump had predicted a Patriots win, saying they would beat the Falcons by eight points. 
Speaking before the game, he told Fox News: “I hate making predictions. I hate to do it.
“But I’ll say … I don’t even know what are the odds, but it’s pretty even, right? Two great teams. Pretty even. So I’ll say the Patriots will win.”
